word.entryDescription: a movement to the ground or a lower position, usually without control
word.entryExample: I had an accident in my kitchen this morning – a nasty fall.

word.entryDescription: to move down quickly from a higher position, usually by accident
word.entryExample: Watching people fall off motorbikes is not my idea of fun!

word.entryDescription: to fall from an upright position onto a surface
word.entryExample: Should you go to hospital if you fall over?

word.entryDescription: a group of people who are related to each other, such as a mother, a father, and their children
word.entryExample: David comes from a big family - he has two sisters and three brothers.

word.entryDescription: known by many people
word.entryExample: We went on the famous bus tour of London last week.

word.entryDescription: well known for a particular reason
word.entryExample: The elephant is famous for its excellent memory, but it is one of the most intelligent creatures on Earth too.

word.entryDescription: somebody who loves a football team, pop group etc and follows everything they do
word.entryExample: Look at all the football fans here!

word.entryDescription: special clothes that you wear to a party where people are dressed to look like famous people or characters
word.entryExample: I'm going to dress as Cinderella for Meg's fancy dress party.

word.entryDescription: extremely good
word.entryExample: It was absolutely fantastic to see the volcano.

word.entryDescription: an adventure designed to feel like happening in an imaginary world
word.entryExample: You can take part in a fantasy adventure in our theme park.

word.entryDescription: at a long distance
word.entryExample: We can walk to Stella's house from here. It isn't far.

word.entryDescription: a long distance
word.entryExample: Fortunately, he didn't go far.

word.entryDescription: a place where plants grow and animals are kept in order to produce food or goods
word.entryExample: What animals are there on the farm?

word.entryDescription: somebody who grows crops or raises animals for food or money
word.entryExample: We buy our meat and vegetables from a farmer.

word.entryDescription: the main house on the farm, where the farmer lives
word.entryExample: Why do some farmhouses in Provence have no windows facing north?

word.entryDescription: a style which becomes popular for a certain time
word.entryExample: Buttons have gone out of fashion.

word.entryDescription: popular with people at a particular time; in fashion
word.entryExample: Some women are proud of their fashionable hats.

word.entryDescription: moving with high speed
word.entryExample: I'm the fastest runner in my class.

word.entryDescription: food which is cooked quickly, and which you often take away from the place where it is cooked
word.entryExample: Technology has also contributed to the rise of fast food chains.

word.entryDescription: something such as a button or zip used to fix together a piece of clothing or a bag
word.entryExample: Fastenings can be decorative.

word.entryDescription: comparative of 'fast' – moving with high speed
word.entryExample: The Olympic motto is 'faster, higher, stronger'.

word.entryDescription: a fat person or animal has a large body and weighs too much
word.entryExample: My teddy bear is quite fat!

word.entryDescription: ending in or causing death
word.entryExample: If the skull is damaged, it could be fatal.

word.entryDescription: your male parent
word.entryExample: My father's name is Peter.

word.entryDescription: to become fatter or make somebody or something fatter
word.entryExample: Are these soya beans being used to fatten chickens and cows?

word.entryDescription: a mistake that you are responsible for causing
word.entryExample: I'm so sorry! I must apologise to you all. It was my fault.

word.entryDescription: all animals that live in a particular area
word.entryExample: The African fauna attracts many visitors from around the globe.

word.entryDescription: your favourite book, film, story, band etc is the one you like more than any other
word.entryExample: My favourite band is playing a concert next week, I have to be there!

word.entryDescription: the feeling of being frightened or very worried
word.entryExample: I took a deep breath, and faced my biggest fear: public performance.

word.entryDescription: bored or annoyed with something because it has continued for too long
word.entryExample: I think people are fed up with finding the same stores everywhere they go.

word.entryDescription: to give food to your pet
word.entryExample: I can feed my pet before school.

word.entryDescription: to experience something physical or emotional
word.entryExample: I feel bad after eating this pizza.

word.entryDescription: to want or wish for something
word.entryExample: I don't feel like going out tonight, let's stay in.

word.entryDescription: how you feel, or what you think
word.entryExample: There is often a great feeling of satisfaction in being able to order a drink or read the menu in the language of the place you are visiting.

word.entryDescription: a thin wall made of wood or metal around a piece of land
word.entryExample: It was so windy that our fence blew over.

word.entryDescription: to go through a chemical change that results in the production of alcohol
word.entryExample: The seeds are dried and fermented in the sun, then dried in an oven and crushed in a mill.

word.entryDescription: a boat or ship which regularly takes passengers from one place to another
word.entryExample: There's a wide choice of tour ships and ferries crossing these huge inland seas, but they are quite expensive.

word.entryDescription: a port for ferries
word.entryExample: The port of Southampton is the biggest ferry port in the UK.

word.entryDescription: a substance added to soil or land to help plants grow
word.entryExample: Fertilisers and insecticides are chemicals used in farming.

word.entryDescription: a day, time of year or event when people do special things, eat special food, etc, often to celebrate something such as a religious occasion
word.entryExample: There is a festival in Menton every year.

word.entryDescription: condition in which the temperature of the body is higher than normal
word.entryExample: Allan came back from Africa with a high fever.

word.entryDescription: some, a small number of something
word.entryExample: There are a few apples in the basket.

word.entryDescription: books and stories about made-up people and events
word.entryExample: I like fiction and non-fiction books.

word.entryDescription: the number 15
word.entryExample: Our break is fifteen minutes long.

word.entryDescription: in the position of number five when we count
word.entryExample: Friday is the fifth day of the week.

word.entryDescription: when people fight
word.entryExample: Fighting isn't allowed.

word.entryDescription: a block of information with a name which is stored on a computer
word.entryExample: I backed up the file as I needed to have a spare copy.

word.entryDescription: to complete information such as your name and address in the empty spaces on a document or form
word.entryExample: Can you help me fill in this application form?

word.entryDescription: (of a car) to pour petrol into the fuel tank
word.entryExample: Switch off your engine while you are filling up!

word.entryDescription: the food that you put inside a sandwich, pie, etc
word.entryExample: What sandwich filling would you like?
